name: SSC CPO (Central Police Organization Exam)
description: A national-level examination conducted by the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) for the recruitment of Sub-Inspector (SI) in Delhi Police and various Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) including BSF, CISF, CRPF, ITBP, and SSB.

eligibility.ageLimit: 20 to 25 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (SC, ST, OBC, Ex-Servicemen etc.) as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: A Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university or equivalent. For the post of Sub-Inspector in Delhi Police (only), male candidates must possess a valid Driving License for LMV (Motorcycle and Car) on the date fixed for Physical Endurance and Measurement Tests (PE&MT).
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan.

timeline.examDate: Paper-I: June 27, 28, 29, 2024. Paper-II: To be notified later.
timeline.resultDate: Results are declared separately for each stage. Final result is declared after the completion of all stages.

examPattern.mode: Online (Computer-Based Test) for Paper-I and Paper-II.

stages.name: Stage 1: Paper-I
stages.description: An online objective test of 200 marks with 200 questions, to be completed in 2 hours. It has four sections: General Intelligence & Reasoning, General Knowledge & General Awareness, Quantitative Aptitude, and English Comprehension.

stages.name: Stage 2: Physical Standard Test (PST) & Physical Endurance Test (PET)
stages.description: Candidates who clear Paper-I are called for PST/PET. It is qualifying in nature and involves physical measurements (height, chest) and physical tasks (running, long jump, high jump, shot put).

stages.name: Stage 3: Paper-II
stages.description: An online objective test of 200 marks focusing on English Language & Comprehension. It has 200 questions to be completed in 2 hours. Only candidates who qualify PST/PET can appear for this paper.

stages.name: Stage 4: Detailed Medical Examination (DME)
stages.description: Candidates shortlisted after Paper-II undergo a medical examination to check their fitness for the posts.

examPattern.markingScheme: In both Paper-I and Paper-II, there is a negative marking of 0.25 marks for each wrong answer. Each correct answer carries 1 mark.

syllabus.name: English Comprehension (Paper-I & Paper-II)
topics: Error Spotting, Fill in the Blanks
